description:
As a Solutions Consultant for Carrier Quality, you'll be responsible for managing relationships with Google’s strategic carrier partners as the face of Google Quality for all ranged phones. You will understand, prioritize, and drive resolution to technical quality issues while you anticipate the business/brand impact of these issues and deliver a succinct communication back to our carrier partners. You'll partner cross-functionally with partnership, technical account managers, marketing, finance, retail operations and product teams at Google to drive a successful product lifecycle. You will also help to shape Google’s best practices, tools, and processes for future Pixel products.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of sales or account management experience with telecommunication devices, consumer electronics or similar manufacturers.
  • Consumer hardware product experience in smartphones or other electronics domain, including hardware development (lifecycle, manufacturing, product development, electrical engineering).

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA degree.
  • Experience in relationship management, with the ability to work towards goals with increasing levels of responsibility and independence.
responsibilities:
• Build and develop working relationship with quality carrier counterparts.
  • Serve as the primary internal and external technical quality liaison for quality issues.
  • Monitor the overall field quality performance for each carrier and prepare carrier specific reporting.
  • Lead carrier specific quality escalations and prioritize issues; Work with internal teams to drive root cause corrective action.
  • Work cross functionally to ensure Google quality remains top of mind for the assigned Carrier.
title: Pixel Carrier Quality Account Manager
